name: 葉樹開
objective: 本課程介紹高分子奈米複合材料之基本原理、製備加工、結構形態與其特殊物理及化學性質，並討論其應用及發展趨勢。
schedule:
Course Outline:
1.　　Introduction to Nanocomposites – Over View of Challenges and Opportunities
2.　　History of Carbon Nanomaterials
3.　　Fundamentals of Carbon-Based Nanocomposites
4.　　Nanocomposites Fabrication
4.1　　Surface Modification
4.2　　Compounding
4.3　　Dispersion
5.　　Nanocomposite Processing
5.1　　The rheology of Polymer Nanocomposites
5.2　　Magnetic or Electric Field Processing
6.　　Properties and Morphology of Nanocomposites
6.1　　Transmission Electron Microscopy
6.2　　Mechanical Properties of Polymer-clay nanocomposites
6.3　　Mass Transport through Polymer Nanocomposites
6.4　　Electrical Properties of Nanoparticle-Filled Polymers
6.5　　Thermal Conductivity of Polymer Nanocomposites
scorePolicy:
Grades:
Grades will be determined from a composite score of all graded materials, consisting of: two midterm exams, homework problems, and the comprehensive final exam. Weights used to determine the final score will be:
1. Homework problems, 15%
2. In-Class Activities, Quizzes 10%
3. Two exams, 60%
4. Final Project 15%
Homework Rules:
1.　　Homework problems are due at the beginning of class.
2.　　Please work the homework early to avoid lateness due to computer crashes.
3.　　Answer keys will be posted on http://elearning.ntut.edu.tw
4.　　You may discuss with others how to begin working problems, but you must work the problem entirely yourself to hand in for credit. You may not share computer files for homework problems until the case study.
5.　　Anyone who share computer files or copy homework from classmates will subject to a 50% off his/her homework credit.
Exams:
Unless otherwise specified, the three exams will be open-book exams. All exams will be held in our normal classroom.
Final Exam:
The final exam will be a comprehensive, open-book final. All students must take the final exam to pass the course. Finals will not be given at any other time. There will not be a make up exam.
